There is a thin sheet of fat between the two layers of the myocardium of the lower right heart chamber. As myocardial cells differ from skin cells, it is not surprising that the electrical signals cannot pass the sheet of fat that lies between the thin and thick layers. In contrast, the thick muscle cells can receive the action potential from the upper layer of the my heart's lower right chamber muscle cells, and do not have problems in conducting the signal to the AV node . Conducting electrical signals on both sides is very slow compared with impulses in the skin, which travel at a speed of 3.2 m per second.
